website_summaries.verdict: Surpasses others on our shortlist for its stability, quality, and cat-attracting materials –hands down the best.
pros: Top of the line construction quality for a scratcher
Offers a nice environment for both lounging and scratching
cons: It's slightly on the heavy side, but it's also rugged and well-made

customer_reviews.title: they both love it. Our beef with this item is it ...
customer_reviews.text: My review is more nuanced than the star system allows for. We have two youngish adult cats. They both adore hanging out on this in the late afternoon sun and they both use it multiple times daily for scratching. So 5 stars for utility, they both love it. Our beef with this item is it only lasted 90 days, and for the last six weeks I've had to pick up or vac up debris multiple times daily. So fair warning: your cats will likely love it but it's durability is disappointing concerning the price. I'm going to replace it with one of the cheaper knock offs as the quality is dubious.
customer_reviews.author: Katybelle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. I found a way to make it ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. I found a way to make it last twice as long with just a little effort!!! After it has seen its last days... slice it down the center and you will have 2 more pieces left. Hey... It's better than nuthin!
customer_reviews.author: HY

customer_reviews.title: 5 star design, construction, and value!
customer_reviews.text: It's always nice to find that a purchase meets the expectations set in the product description - the PetFusion Cat Scratcher and Lounge actually exceeded my expectations! Tight, solid construction combined with a beautiful, modern design. * size/height/weight is excellent for taking a good knock without tipping over as he dashes through the cubby holes * catnip doesn't just fall straight through = less waste * neutral colors look great in my living-room Compared to what I've paid for plain jumbo scratchers this is an EXCELLENT value. Very pleased with this purchase and would definitely buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: Desert Gypsy

customer_reviews.title: My kitties love it.
customer_reviews.text: The second "PetFusion Ultimate Cat Scratcher Lounge" was delivered, my cats took right to it! All five of them wanted to be on it or near it. So far, it looks like it will exceed my expectations. Feb 29th, 2016 - back to add to my review! My cats use this all the time. All five. I have one cat who has nail issues, and usually refuses to scratch anything, but he is using this like crazy, and his nails issue has improved so much in the short amount of time we've had this. Super amazing. I'll be back for more!
customer_reviews.author: alienCat

customer_reviews.title: a MUST have!!
customer_reviews.text: I had originally purchased this bed/scratcher a year ago and decided to throw it out and try another one. It was just getting a little messy, but nothing a quick sweep once a day can't take care of. I tried a few other beds and scratching post, but my cat got depressed, refused to use any of the other beds or scratching toys, started scratching furniture again, and cried every night she didn't have it. I ordered a new one and I've never seen her happier. I'll never buy any other cat bed or scratching posts! This is the best, HANDS DOWN. 5 stars!!
customer_reviews.author: Ikadri

customer_reviews.title: It falls apart
customer_reviews.text: The cat likes it; unfortunately it seems of poor quality. No option for contacting manufacture I can locate, I guess I'm stuck with this defective and / or poor quality item, for which I paid $50.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Linsin

customer_reviews.title: Our cat Jet LOVES this! She runs through the ...
customer_reviews.text: Our cat Jet LOVES this! She runs through the open parts and lounges on the top - so we call it the Jet Lounger :)
customer_reviews.author: SusanB

customer_reviews.title: READ THIS BEFORE BUYING
customer_reviews.text: I will agree with everyone about the fact that this cat scratcher is really good. It feels solid, is big and the curvy design is something the cat loves. I mean, look at the video. However, if your cat is like mine, and have huge claws (Believe me, he's a little particular with people trying to cut them), it will not last more than 4/5 months. I had it for less than 3 days and one of the sides is already crumbling. And no, this is not the only scratcher our cat has. Besides this, I think 49$ is a little too much for it. 35 or 39$ would be a more reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: David Hurt

customer_reviews.title: TOO BIG
customer_reviews.text: I’m glad I didn’t pay full price for this thing, got one of the warehouse deals. Anyone who pays $50 for this crap is insane. The problem is it’s too big and heavy, it takes up the entire half wall of my apartment! Don’t even think about hanging it, it will tear down ur wall. The cat sits on cardboard scratchers all the time and barely touches this thing, let alone sit on it. Save ur money and buy a $10 cardboard one.
customer_reviews.author: Optombooks

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and compressed cardboard is all this is. Would Not recommend as it also leaves the cardboard pieces everywhere. I already vacuum every morning and by afternoon there’s more cardboard pieces all over. Save your money and buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Iven

customer_reviews.title: My house will never be without one.
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my third one. I bought for my cat that uses the stair riser as a scratching post. I thought turned sideways but she had no interest in it. The other cats enjoyed it. So after a year or so I bought a second one. That one the first cat turned out loved it and now is her favorite spot. Now I'm on my third. I sawed the first one in half so the inside can be used too. The smallest cat loves laying in the "elbow". Pictures are of a new lounger, a used to the max lounger, and a half in use lounger.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it, but not wearing well
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this but it is not holding up well. It appears to not be made very well. She is a hefty girl so I am getting another one, but I would be hesitant to recommend this because it is not wearing well. I saw other reviews that addressed this problem. Apparently, at one time they were made very well, now they appear cheaper and the cardboard looks shabby at 6 wks.
customer_reviews.author: KYREADER

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: One of these days I'll learn that thousands of positive reviews usually mean beware. I bought this on the claims that it would last for years and didn't shred like cheaper versions. Hah! See photo and surrounding carpet. Scratcher after 3 weeks; carpet after 3 days. Unfortunately I purchased two of these and missed the window to return the other one.
customer_reviews.author: Literary Li Li

customer_reviews.title: Avoid for the safety of your cats
customer_reviews.text: I cannot recommend this even though the cats love it. The problem is that it quickly deteriorates, leaving small bits of cardboard on the floor and, more dangerously, on the cats' fur. They then clean themselves and ingest the cardboard, which, of course, leads to them throwing up. I have had two of these, and they are both disasters. I have to vacuum then every day to remove the bits of cardboard, but even then, my cats ingest enough to make them vomit. Sadly, I would say avoid this for the safety of your cats.
customer_reviews.author: J. Finkel

customer_reviews.title: Quality is way down on this one
customer_reviews.text: This is the fifth one of these I've bought and (fourth from Amazon), and the quality is way down. The glue is separating, so the cat's claws could easily fit between the pieces of glued together cardboard, and the cut is uneven. First bad product I've gotten from petfusion (also own two PetFusion food mats) DIsappointed this one made it through quality control. Sending back. Edit: one star to four. Emailed pet fusion and the company is sending a replacement. I’m happy with that resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. D. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: HUGE
customer_reviews.text: This arrived scratched up like it had been used. And, I obviously didn’t pay attention to the dimensions because it is so freaking HUGE!!!! I couldn’t believe it when UPS dropped it off and when I opened it. Once I saw it was beat up and dirty, I put back in box to return it and it was so big, I wanted out of my apartment, so I went to put in my trunk & it filled the length of my trunk - just to help with visual. I do appreciate the seller letting me return
customer_reviews.author: Leto74

customer_reviews.title: and I like it because it serves more than one purpose and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second lounger I have bought for my cat, because she completely wore out the first one. It's safe to say she loves it, and I like it because it serves more than one purpose and it's a lot more aesthetically pleasing than other cat scratchers. The ends of it are perfect for my cat to stand on her hind legs and scratch it, and we also place it on its side long ways and she can start out the window while she lays on the end. Overall, very impressed with this product, and will definitely be buying another one soon!
customer_reviews.author: DelaneyTop Contributor: Eye Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Cat tested and approved!
customer_reviews.text: I know what you are thinking - i am not spending $50 on a cat scratcher. I thought the same thing myself. But this is so much more than a cat scratcher. It is a great design and durable. We had the first one for two years. I took another reviewer's suggestion of cutting it in half when the outside becomes completely shredded, so then the inner part can be shredded. My cat though prefers sleeping in the sun in its original design. So it is a cat scratcher, a cat bed, and a beautiful design. My cat loves it and so it has definitely been worth the $50.
customer_reviews.author: ape

customer_reviews.title: Great product for cat and his guardian alike!
customer_reviews.text: I recently adopted a ten-year-old cat from the local shelter, and it's been a bit of a guessing game with a senior cat who has definite, if mysterious, preferences already! This cat scratcher lounge has been the BIGGEST hit by far. He knew immediately what to do, and it keeps him well mannered with his claws. Also, he loves hanging out on it, and even likes to play hide-in-seek in the "tunnel" ends. From the human perspective, the lounger is handsome enough to happily bring it in the living room. Also, it seems sturdy to last for years to come. Great product for cat and his guardian alike!
customer_reviews.author: Jd.22

customer_reviews.title: Immediately Loved by Pirate Cat
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a slightly larger scratching structure for my newest household addition, Laith the Pirate Cat. This visually artistic piece caught my eye (as well as Pirate Cat's single peeper). As soon as I unpacked it, Laith determined that this is his favorite perch and scratch station! Not only is it incredibly sturdy, and adding that very cool sculptural feel...the fact that you can flip it for twice the useful life is a total win-win for me! This may be the new gift that I send off with each of my foster cats for their new forever home! If Pirate Cat likes this, you will love it!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Not bad.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about 5 months and it gets a few hours of daily use from both my males. It is sturdy and looks as "aesthetically pleasing" as you could imagine a cat scratcher to look inside your home. I did have to turn it over already and it's getting to the point of needing replacement soon. At the price point $50, that's $10/month for this scratcher. Not the most economical option. You get more mileage out of a sisal scratcher. However, mine do like this one and I'll look around for a better deal.
customer_reviews.author: Some Blue Devil

customer_reviews.title: Worked instantly like catnip.
customer_reviews.text: Despite having a few scratch posts, our fluffy fam kept going after the carpet on the stairs and was taking chunks out. Somehow my intuition told me this was the fix and I couldn't help but seeing her love it in my minds eye. Turns out better than imagined. Not only did she stop going after the stairs all together but she made me bust out laughing how enthusiastically she got attached to it as soon as it came out of the package. Thanks for a great product, she shreds it daily and it barely has a dent. The catnip you send is exceptionally good as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!!
customer_reviews.text: My rescue cat was starting to scratch the furniture, and he's apparently too good for the regular rectangular scratching boards I used to get for previous cats. So I took a chance on this. He initially ignored it until I put it right where he had to walk past it every day - and suddenly he decided it was worth his attention. I've had it over a year and it still looks fairly new. He scratches it multiple times a day - which has helped preserve the furniture!!! All in all a worthwhile investment. It should last at least another 3 years before needing replaced!
customer_reviews.author: Black Diamond Skier

customer_reviews.title: Must-Buy Item For Cat Parents
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had my eye on this cat scratcher lounge for the past couple of years, but never took the plunge until now. This lounge is not only larger and sturdier than I anticipated, but the quality of the materials from which it’s made is impeccable. I expect this to endure many a scratch from my two cats. This cat lounge is totally worth the cost and I hope to add a few more of these to my home in the near future! Pros: * Sturdy composition * High-quality materials * Elegant, modern & minimalistic aesthetic that complements most, if not all, home design/decor. Cons: * None. I only wish I could’ve purchased this sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Ziggy

customer_reviews.title: Saved my furniture!!
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking to save your furniture GET this! I’ve had trouble in the past with being able to train the cat to use something besides the furniture until I got this. Just sprinkle cat nip on it once a week and this is the go to now! Thank the Lord!! Everything to LOVE with this sturdy cat lounger! I bought one for my Moms 3 cats because my three love ours so much. Her cats are declawed, but still love the feel of massaging their paws on it. My cats are not declawed and my furniture is safe now! Thinking about buying a few more for Christmas presents this year :)
customer_reviews.author: Customer1024

customer_reviews.title: Still going after 2 years of use
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, heavy-duty, strong, durable, and long-lasting. My cats love scratching and laying on this uniquely shaped scratching pad. It literally has small dips in it where their favorite scratching spots are and it is still going strong. Next month will be two years since the original purchase date and I am just now thinking of replacing it, but honestly, I could probably get another 6-12 months out of it it just doesn't look very nice after 2 years use.
customer_reviews.author: KookieBaron

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: I really didn’t want to invest this much in a cat scratcher but we desperately needed a good one because I was buying new cheap ones every month. This thing is massive and VERY high quality. I didn’t expect it to be so big, but it’s great. Our cat LOVES it and uses it all the time. This scratcher hardly sheds any cardboard. Worth the investment already because of how long it has lasted... and you can still cut it in half to use the inside pieces after the outside is completely done. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Yvette

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Scratcher!
customer_reviews.text: We initially bought one of these about 4 years ago and were very impressed with it. About two years ago, we bought a second one because we thought the first one was near end of life. However, both are still going very strong so we just have them at opposite ends of the house. Our cat absolutely loves it, no catnip needed. He occasionally lounges on it, but mostly uses it for scratching, which means he doesn't claw anything else he's not supposed to. This is without a doubt the best scratcher we've ever purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony/Rachal Nocchi

customer_reviews.title: Favourite spot to lounge!
customer_reviews.text: Our kittens love this lounger! It is nice and big and there is definitely room for both of them, but most of the time they just fight over who gets it. Sometimes they snuggle on it. The holes are plenty big for them to run through, and our biggest is 8.5 pounds. So they are constantly running through the holes playing. The one uses it as a scratcher too which is nice, but it's held up very well. It's even sturdy enough that I can sit on it too! Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Toodles

customer_reviews.title: I love it, my two cats love it. Enough said!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I don't have a window sill, and both my cats likes to jump up to the little bit of area beside the window to look outside. I got this and secured this to the wall, now its like an extension of window seat! They love it, they would lie on the cat lounge and nap, I think they like napping beside the window because the sun shines in! My cats are a little big to fit in the two holes in the middle, but that being said, they still stick their heads in and scratch the cardboard. Love the design, doesn't look cheap, and is an accessory to my room too!! thank you Pet Fusion!
customer_reviews.author: tiny

customer_reviews.title: The varmints love it. It doesn't move around when they're giving ...
customer_reviews.text: The varmints love it. It doesn't move around when they're giving their claws a workout and it keeps them from shredding the furniture. Not as big as I expected but then it's cat-sized. I'm not a fan of incorporating pet accoutrements like this into my decor so any suggestions for improvement would be purely aesthetic. The cardboard does shed a bit when they're shredding it but it's functional and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Zazalu

customer_reviews.title: Shredding, but doing it’s job
customer_reviews.text: My rescue was trained not to scratch furnishings so it’s important to provide a scratching surface and keep nails groomed regularly. The cardboard types are wonderful, except when they begin to shred, it travels on fur and gets deposited all over. This lounger promised to be longer lasting, far more money than I paid in the past, I decided to make the investment. Yes, it feels firmer out of the shrink wrap. After a few weeks it started to show signs of wear. After only 2 months, it is shredding. Yes, the lounger is doing what it is supposed to but at a quadruple the price I will only get twice the life.
customer_reviews.author: SewShelly

customer_reviews.title: Total mess!
customer_reviews.text: We have 4 cats and bought this as advertised to be indestructible vs the cheap cardboard typically used for said items. Totally destructible! It's a daily mess on the floor. Cats really love it for both scratching and lounging.
customer_reviews.author: Elysha Magnum

customer_reviews.title: Totally shocked! It's like a Magic Cat Magnet
customer_reviews.text: Good News: My cats (one young, one old) immediately took to it. They love it and have stopped lounging on human furniture and getting cat fur all over the sofa (one is a long haired cat). Bad News (but not really): They've stopped using the cat hammocks which I got them a couple of weeks ago because they love this cat lounge so much. I was hoping they would like this, but genuinely surprised how much they did. I immediately ordered another one for the bedroom and they took to that to, so now there's a lot less cat fur on the bed. Construction is dense and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: errorfound482

customer_reviews.title: If you have a cat with claws you need this!
customer_reviews.text: This is like our 3rd or 4th of this item and I can honestly say we will always buy this exact brand. They last so long and my cats love them! My daughters apartment recently flooded and she moved in with us temporarily with her cat. Her cat loves our scratchers but they were needing replaced so eventually she started scratching our couch. I immediately ordered a new one and she hasn’t touched the couch since it arrived. My husband is going to cut the older ones in half so they have fresh surface to scratch and we will place these in various areas so they have “options” lol.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Kennah

customer_reviews.title: My cat prefers it to other scratching products
customer_reviews.text: My cat was attracted to it immediately, and started scratching it and even slept on it the first night. She will not scratch a post covered by carpet - there is something about this compressed hardened cardboard material that makes her enjoy scratching it. A small bag of catnip comes with it to enhance the initial experience for your cat. I feel confident this will last quite a while since it is reversible and has a large surface area. When one side eventually gets worn out, I'll just flip it over and my cat will have a brand new fresh side to scratch.
customer_reviews.author: sleater_kinney_rox

customer_reviews.title: My cats LOVE it BUT it's already making a mess on day 2.
customer_reviews.text: My cats LOVE it. It's a lounger and a scratcher. They loved the box it came in too. LOL Unfortunately, this is day 2 and they are already making a small mess with the shreds from scratching it. I'll keep it because they're obviously already tearing it up but I don't think I will buy another one. I also don't see this lasting long. I see a lot of vacuuming paper shreds in my future.
customer_reviews.author: Shopmom0829

customer_reviews.title: My cats love this lounger/scratcher so much, I bought a second one
customer_reviews.text: Two of our cats like this lounger so much that as soon as one gets up to eat, drink, or whatever, the other takes his place. No brawls, but only occasional sharing (it _is_ big enough for two cats to share, if they get along). So we bought a second one, and put it in a different window. Now both of them are happy. Really lovely design, well made with very tight cardboard (not like a standard shipping box!), these have been a pleasure to look at, unlike some of the disposable "box" scratchers that we've used (which the cats also love, and destroy).
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Alderete

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: We didn't actually believe all the reviews.. but our boy loves it! He's on it all the time, and loves to scratch it, sleep on it, just be on it. He's about 15 pounds and it fits him just perfect! It's very strong and well made. We put his little mousie on it, and he doesn't like to share, so he always swats the mousie off his lounger. :) I like the design, as it's a nice stylish piece of cat furniture in the room. It's holding up well and we still haven't flipped it, and it's been like 4 months. Get it one for your fur baby!
customer_reviews.author: EBB

customer_reviews.title: Great aesthetic for cat furniture
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described. It’s beautiful and sturdy, most importantly my new shy, and quite particular about everything cat loves it and has made it one of her go-to spots. She won’t scratch on anything else except cardboard so I tried this because it looks cool! She was scratching on it and got annoyed with the photo shoot interruption but she really does like it!
customer_reviews.author: Ellz

customer_reviews.title: Our cats love these other loungers and scratchers
customer_reviews.text: We got 2 of these loungers with the dip in the middle and our kitties love them. We have them next to the larger one cause it is a cat haven for them and they love them. They can also lay on them at the same time or even on different levels cause they can!!! They also play in and around them, orange Andy loves to hide and sneak attack Ray too!!!( pic #3) You don't have to get two of them and you don't have to get the different sizes together but we do it cause this gives them lots of choices and lots of lounging and scratching room!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa T.

customer_reviews.title: Best cat scratcher/lounger EVER
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased my 2nd Ultimate Cat Scratcher Lounger. What an amaizng products! My cats are in love with it. By far the best thing I've ever purchased in my life for my cats. I've gotten several scratchers and corrugated cardboard before, and I was intimidated by the price, but it's so worth it. It far outlasts other products similar to this. I would love to try other products from this company! Owner of 2 playful kitties!
customer_reviews.author: KJo

customer_reviews.title: NOT WORTH IT.
customer_reviews.text: This destroys just as easy as a cheap $5 one from Petco. Looks cool and it's big but other than that I still have debris everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Alyson House

customer_reviews.title: Great Design. Cats love it. Not terribly durable
customer_reviews.text: My cats love the curved design. It's the perfect shape for them to lounge. We've got two of these in different rooms and the cats both love them, both for sleeping on and for scratching. The 1st one we bought came a bit squished but it's held up well otherwise in the last few months. The 2nd one we got two weeks ago came in perfect shape but somehow is showing more wear than the 1st one. Not sure what the deal is there. But all in all, since the cats love them and they look much better than the traditional scratching posts, I'd say they are well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: House Wife

customer_reviews.title: My Cat's Favorite Scratcher
customer_reviews.text: Before I purchased this, my cat had a small circular cardboard scratcher that she scratched on but she was barely able to curl her little body on top (to claim as hers.) She took to this like it was the greatest gift. Several times a day she scratches on it and I find her often stretching out on the top. She has several other scratchers in the home, some sisal, but this is her favorite. Every so often, I have to take it outside to dump the loose scratchings but this is true of all cardboard scratchers. It is good and sturdy and will last for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cats enjoy it!
customer_reviews.text: We move this away from a wall and my 2 cats have fun playing on it. They run through the holes and enjoy reaching for things that they put under it. This is a great tool for them to stretch and scratch on. My 2 cats take turns napping on top. We often leave it up against a wall because it does take up a lot of floor space and because one of my my casts tends to routinely fall off the back side while sleeping. I highly recommend it for your felines. My cats really enjoy lounging on the PetFusion Ultimate Cat Scratcher Lounge on the daily.
customer_reviews.author: Freedom, Liberty, and Justice for all

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: First off, it actually looks stylish as compared to all other cat set ups. Our 4 mo old kitten really likes it and took to it right away. He's even started laying on it like a bed recently. Hasn't prevented him from scratching on anything else, but 90% is done on this. When he was smaller, he loved going in and out of the openings.... not so much anymore. We've had it for almost 2 months now and haven't had to flip it over yet. Needless to say, when this thing can't do it's job anymore, I'll want to get another.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Greene

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cat scratcher and it doesn't cause quite as big of a mess as most of the ones that you find in the pet stores. The quality is great in the design is fun for the cats. It is just cardboard, so I think it's a little bit expensive for what it is, but I'm glad that I purchased it and when it wears out, I probably will get another one. It's taking much longer to wear out then other scratchers. So in that way, it does have added value. Plus it does double as a bed and a perch. Your cats will love it!
customer_reviews.author: S. Mcgurk

customer_reviews.title: My 2 cats love it.
customer_reviews.text: I put it next to the chair they've been caught scratching and they've stopped using the chair because they like the "lounge" better. When it 1st arrived, I rubbed it with some of the catnip that came with it, placed a cat on it then scratched on it with my own fingernail for them to see (don't rub your cat's toes on it, they don't like that). You will find bits of cardboard on the floor, but hey, sweeping up some cardboard is totally worth not having your furniture shredded. I haven't had it long enough to speak to its longevity. BTW - my cats don't "lounge" on it.
customer_reviews.author: tweetydee

customer_reviews.title: Love at First Scratch
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my CH cat since his balance challenges make it hard for him to climb and scratch on upright scratchers. Both Scramble and his baby brother started using it immediately. The top is a favorite lounge site and Scramble loves to use an inner loop for ambushes. Best gift I have ever come uo with for my special guy!
customer_reviews.author: H. Raymond

customer_reviews.title: My Cat's Favorite Place
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves to scratch AND sleep on this scratcher! He loves it. However, it does leave a lot of cardboard flakes everywhere, but I'm not sure if that is preventable at all. It is also much more expensive than competitors (I saw the same exact scratcher for less than half the price of this one). My kitty loved this though, so I have no choice but to leave a positive review :) I love the modern design and the way it looks in my house. I will recommend looking at TJ Maxx for this scratcher however, because they carry it and for much cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Spiker

customer_reviews.title: My cats love this!
customer_reviews.text: My two cats both loved this post. They scratched on it, they slept on it. They used it all the time. It’s super sturdy and has lasted me almost 3 years. When one side got worn out I just flipped it to the other side. Even worn out my cats still scratched on it. I really appreciate how happy this made my babies, my one and only complaint is that this make me have to sweep daily. The cardboard debris this makes when they scratch on it is very annoying when trying to keep my apartment clean. That’s my only comment, and it’s kinda worth it when they love it so much.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Soledispa

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Loves It!!
customer_reviews.text: We moved and decided to get our cat a new cat tree. She always used the old one for scratching so I hoped she would use the new one too. WRONG! She started scratching furniture and carpet. I read that cats sometimes need horizontal scratching devices too. After looking at lots of products I decided on the PetFusion Ultimate Cat Scratcher Lounge. My cat started using it for scratching the minute I got it unpacked. Put a little catnip on it and she rolls around on her back as well. I am very happy with how she has taken to it. She's still scratching other things a little but it is way down and hopefully it will stop completely.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Amazing scratcher and lounge for my cat
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these for my mom a few winters ago for her cats. I just got a cute exotic shorthair cat of my own recently and this was a must buy for him so he could scratch on something. He is constantly coming to this scratcher to flex and stretch his claws on something. And it really is as strong as the claim, I have stood on it and I am 235 pounds at the moment. My brother who weighs more than me also stands on my mom's and it has held up fine. And the cats love to go in and out of the inside of the scratcher.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Dual-functionality, durable
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for steps for my elderly cat to get to the bedside table so she could hop into bed. I was appalled by the cost and ugliness of the options. But then I found this, which also functions as a cat scratching station. Yay! My older cat has no trouble getting onto the lower part of the lounger and the higher side she uses to get to the table and then to the bed. And the younger cat gets to have a bedroom scratching station. Double yay! And it arrived with a surprise of organic catnip crushed leaves, superior to the weird pulverized/powdered catnip that comes with other scratching units.
customer_reviews.author: S. Berg

customer_reviews.title: Superb Product
customer_reviews.text: I took in a stray pregnant cat and bought one of these about one and a half years ago. I already had four cats and momma had five kittens! I still have the original! It is looking pretty rough, but several of the cats still lay on it and scratch it. I just ordered another one and put it out. I recommend this product. It is made well and lasts! The kittens used to lay in the middle sections, (now they are too big). All but one of my cats like to scratch on it, I think it is because she likes to scratch on the cat tree poles, (a vertical scratcher). It is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: G L B

customer_reviews.title: My cat approves , high quality cat scratcher! Save your couch!
customer_reviews.text: We were looking to save our new couch from getting scratched and decided to add more cat scratchers to our living room.This is a more expensive one and there were many others like this at a much lower price but you get what you pay for in quality. Our cat Charlie loves this very much and used it right away.He loves scratching and lounging on it.The feel is of very high quality and looks like it will last a long long time.We trim his nails once a week or so specially the front paws.
customer_reviews.author: Mimgy

customer_reviews.title: Purrfect!
customer_reviews.text: This is the ideal lounger for me in my humans' sunroom. It feels good on my claws, and the contour is conducive to excellent afternoon naps. The texture feels good when I sharpen my claws, too. Now I'm hoping they order a separate one for my pesky sister, since she wants to lie on it all the time, too. - Brisco
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My kitten's favorite spot
customer_reviews.text: I brought home a 14-week-old Ragdoll kitten, first pet I've had in 20 years, to a safe haven room decked out like kitty Disneyland. Of all the scratching surfaces (there were three) and places to sleep (at least seven), this was the thing he chose for his first night in my apartment. Granted, I perched it on a truck near a window, but he took to it right away. He uses this for scratching more than the sisal rope tree or sisal fabric post I bought. Very sturdy, heavy, larger than you'd imagine. I'll have to wait and see how long it lasts, but so far it's one of the best things I bought for my kitten.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvie

customer_reviews.title: Another great product!
customer_reviews.text: This cat scratcher/lounge is another great product from Pet Fusion! A few years ago I purchased their scratcher/triangle for my five cats, and despite nearly constant use, they haven't managed to hurt it at all! The cardboard is very high quality, unlike less expensive scratchers, which start to shed bits of cardboard and disintegrate very shortly. This new piece has been enthusiastically in use since its arrival yesterday, and I'm sure it will last for a long time, just like the triangle has. Although a bit more expensive, the Pet Fusion products are well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Mizpat

customer_reviews.title: Cat didn't scratch unless I set it upright
customer_reviews.text: My cat would lay on it once in a while. But he didn't scratch on it until I leaned it against wall upright. We are talking a huge 2 feet long piece so not stable when its leaning. When he does scratch it, there is a ton of cardboard shavings on the floor so he must enjoy it. He did scratch on the painted sides in a couple places so that ruined the sleek side view. I would not buy again. With it upright there are only 2 sides to destroy in the middle and then time to toss it. The ends still are perfect but he doesn't scratch there.
customer_reviews.author: lmh

customer_reviews.title: A year and a half later
customer_reviews.text: I've had this scratcher for two cats for a year and a half now and am finally ready to toss it. Granted, they have other ways to stretch their claws (another scratching post, balcony with rough flooring). A little advice for extending its lifespan, once both sides of the scratcher are exhausted, break out a saw and cut the thing in half lengthwise then places the halves side by side. Now you have an extra wide lounge with the fresh inner surface exposed for another month of scratching. Good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Jey

customer_reviews.title: I am pleased with the quality of the cardboard
customer_reviews.text: My new kitten started using this right away. I am pleased with the quality of the cardboard. It is very tightly pressed and should last a long time. I sprayed the scratcher with catnip oil as one reviewer recommended. Anyway, I am really happy. I thought it was pricey, but if it keeps a kitten from scratching my new couch, it is well worth it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Clem C. Lambeth

customer_reviews.title: Who says a kitty doesn't need a lounger? Loves it!
customer_reviews.text: FiFi, my cat, adores her lounger. We have tried many scratchers. They all leave shreds of cardboard or sisal everywhere. You may pay a tad more for this lounger but it's well worth it. Not only does it not leave shreds everywhere but FiFi actually lounges on it. It does shred a tiny, tiny bit but just a bit. It's not enough to complain about. FiFi lies on it like it's her furniture and it is. She scratches it on the regular. The lounger is worth the money. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: FiFi

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy this because of the price. I had bought a different cardboard scratch pad previously for $15 and the cat used it so much but it shredded and broke. We have had this one for several months now and it was seriously worth every penny. My cat sleeps on it, and scratches it so much during the day and it still looks pretty good! The cardboard is so compacted that it’s not getting trashed looking like the other one. The best part is he completely stopped scratching my furniture. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No more scratching the rug or furniture
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves the cat scratch lounger. And that is a great name for this product. My cat has a cat scratcher in the bedroom which she uses but when in the living area she scratches the area rug and coffee table and WALLS. I bought another expensive cat scratcher post. No deal. I saw a review on this product and bought it. My cat immediately used it and then lounged on it to look out the window. It is her new favorite spot. Greatest invention ever.
customer_reviews.author: J. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Picky Cat Loves This- Serves Multiple Purposes & High Quality
customer_reviews.text: * Design looks great/sleek * Bought it originally to go at the foot of bed to deter cat from scratching the footboard, and it worked! * Post-radioiodine treatment cat had some issues jumping onto the bed during recovery. This served as a sturdy option instead of buying the pet stairs * She lays on it when she's not on the bed, like a little throne * Great scratcher, has held up for months and if the cardboard gets too worn down you can always flip it over HIGHLY Recommend (pic is before we moved it to front of bed, she took to it right away)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great cat toy
customer_reviews.text: These cat lounges/scratchers are terrific. I have a 14 pound cat with a full set of claws. We have used these Pet Fusion lounges for her for ten years. We love them and so does the cat. She took immediately to the piece as her favorite bed and, more importantly, as her favorite place to sharpen her claws. She never scratches anywhere else. We replace the lounge every two or three years when the cat has shredded it, but it takes that long. This is a really useful and pleasant piece and our cat lives on it and loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The design is beautiful so it’s also a living room accent piece in ...
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves scratching and lounging around on this thing all the time. The design is beautiful so it’s also a living room accent piece in a way. It’s the cat’s favorite place to hang out and definitely not an eyesore like most cardboard cat scratchers. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Nataly Ouvarova

customer_reviews.title: Best cat lounger and scratcher
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something functional but not ugly for my 2 kittens --this fit the bill 100%. I got the white (to go with my white and grey living room) and people have commented on how nice it looks for a cat scratcher. My kittens love it, one likes to nap and lounge on it all day, they both love darting in and out of the loops & both use this to scratch and don't touch my sofa. Win on all fronts! I liked it so much i bought a second one for my bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Maine Coon approved!
customer_reviews.text: I have a very large nebelung- about 18 lbs and features of a Maine Coon. This thing is a hell of a lot bigger than I had imagined - overlooked the package in our package room several times due to the size of the box. This is a great thing. Smokey Robinson has been hanging around on this scratcher and playing even more than usual. As I write this, hes stretching out along the full length of it and has apparently chosen this over his 80" king cat tower.
customer_reviews.author: David Heumann

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, functional, great for small spaces
customer_reviews.text: People have asked me where I got this from. It’s gorgeous, which is important since we live in a studio apartment where everything is very exposed. Many scratching boards are really eyesores so this was a great find. We put it under our coffee table and out kitties love sitting on it and scratching it. Once this finally breaks, which should take forever, we’ll definitely buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Coco

customer_reviews.title: Ragdoll approved!
customer_reviews.text: From the very first time we sat our little Mochi on this he knew exactly what it was for. He's four months now and has never scratched furniture. I like the shape, and the fact that I can move it around with ease. If he's in the bedroom for the afternoon we move this with him, and he is always on it when we return. I first saw this on FloppyCats, and knew to purchase it prior to bringing our baby home. I highly recommend the site if you've never had a cat before, or it's been a while, and you want good, solid advice.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley R

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and very durable!!
customer_reviews.text: My cats LOVE this!!!!! It's been in my house of rover a year now, and it is still their favorite scratcher. It's huge, and although they use it every day, and tear into it all the time, it isn't anywhere near being worn out. I expect them to get at least another year or 2 out of this. One of my cats loves to chase toys through the openings in it. They also love to sleep on it. I'm definitely going to get a second one to replace the other scratchers they've worn out. I thought this was pretty expensive when I got it, but it was DEFINITELY worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Scratcher and Bed
customer_reviews.text: PetFusion Ultimate Cat Scratcher Lounge This isn't cheap, but one of my cats practically lives on this thing and when he's off eating then someone else snaps it up. It's a scratcher! It's a bed! It's a great place for them to fight when one of them tries to bat off whichever one is sleeping! Ah-ha, we have fun. Scratchers don't last forever, but this one is sturdy and takes a lot of scratching before anything starts flaking off. I think it's a fair price. ~ Ana Mardoll
customer_reviews.author: Ana Mardoll

customer_reviews.title: The crew and I are very happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: The unique design and sturdy construction make this a hit with my feline family members. I lean it against the wall next to a window ledge and they use it to climb like a tree into the window, often stopping mid-climb to scratch as they would on a live tree. This is my second one, the first has been scratched so much it looked naked; but we cut it in half across each end, turned it so that the inside was facing up, and set halves on the floor for more fresh scratching area!! Win-win and extends the life of this expensive item.
customer_reviews.author: M. Weisbeck

customer_reviews.title: Excellent scratcher for multi-cat house
customer_reviews.text: I've tried various [cheaper] scratchers and two of the biggest issues were: (1) they don't last long, and (2) once they've been scratched for awhile, cardboard pieces start falling all over the floor. This is the 3rd time I'm buying a scratcher from Pet Fusion, since it's of my much better quality, lasts a lot longer, and doesn't cause nearly as much cardboard mess as the other products. Will definitely continue buying from the company.
customer_reviews.author: Leon Gokhman

customer_reviews.title: My Cat loves this!
customer_reviews.text: He lives on it!!! This is his 4th or 5th one. He weighs over 30 pounds and this supports his weight without issue. He has claws of steel and this last about 6 months with him clawing and scratching on it daily. I would say this is his favorite "toy" and we'll keep him supplied with them!
customer_reviews.author: Royce Michna

customer_reviews.title: But that's easy to clean up
customer_reviews.text: Kitty loves this so much. It's his sofa and his scratcher. He loves it so much that he's ripped off the paper that lines the sides of the product. So I've got little pieces of shredded paper on the floor. But that's easy to clean up, and it's much preferred to have him shred this than my furniture. The scratcher is nice to look at as well. Will be buying another one once kitty has destroyed this one.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: CATS LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my fourth PetFusion Ultimate Cat Scratcher Lounge. They are a magnet for cats! They have a satisfying corrugated cardboard texture that they love to pick on... and the graceful curve totally fits their bodies. You'll love watching your cat discover the lounge. Also the graceful shape looks good in any room. Mine sits in the living room and looks great with the wooden furniture. Get this for the excellent entertainment as your cat scratches, rolls, stretches...then happily falls asleep on it. BONUS- it comes with a small bag of REALLY good catnip to get the party started!
customer_reviews.author: R. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Cats + Lounge = Love at First Scratch
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this! The first moment I set it down, my "problem child" was on it, scratching away and rolling over on it. When her cat brother tried to take a turn, she was not budging. I put a little cat nip on it to let them know it was theirs, and they were all over it! I ordered 2 other Pet Fusion items recently and, between them, they have saved my new furniture because they are apparently far more fun that destroying my new chairs. Yea!!! All have been good products and seem to be holding up well, even with 2 large cats shredding on them many times a day. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: jr2012

customer_reviews.title: Most Domestic house cats would love it
customer_reviews.text: I have a feral cat that is a very difficult inside pet. She thought it smelled wonderful, rubbed he head on the sides. And that was it. I’m very sure a normal house cat would love this up one side and down the other. She won’t even sit on it. I was sad because I wanted her to work out her nails. I know previous cats would have loved it day & night. It’s nicely made, sturdy and should last for years. Delivery was prompt.
customer_reviews.author: Year of the Ox

customer_reviews.title: Scratcher, Perch and Bed All-in-One
customer_reviews.text: My cat simply loves it. When we watch TV at night she will jump up and use the scratcher then look out into the backyard. The scratcher lasts several months and you can simply flip it over and use the other side once one side gets worn. She also loves sleeping on it during the day while the sun shines through. She is a large cat and as you see in the photo she is quite happy with it. I will be buying another one to put next to it so that I can wrap a blanket around the old one for sleeping and she can use the new one for more scratching.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: I had to buy a second one to avoid sibling sparring!
customer_reviews.text: This product just arrived today. The catnip scent must attract the cats. I have 4 cats. They all immediately wanted to use it. Eventually my biggest cat, who is usually very mellow, claimed it and refused to let the others on. My husband and I decided to order a second one so all of them could have a turn. I am not sure about how study this is, so that is the only area I did not give a 4. But we absolutely love it! Whoever designed this, really knew cats.
customer_reviews.author: C. Long

customer_reviews.title: Voted favorite scratcher by my three kitties!
customer_reviews.text: I have three cats and bought two of these about eight months ago and then another two recently. They lasted almost eight months. This is double-sided, so once they use one side, you can flip it over and use the other side. All three cats use this scratcher more than any other. The shape is such that they love to sleep on it. One of my cats is a Maine Coon and weighs 22 pounds. He stands on top of it at the edge and scratches and it doesn’t budge. Very sturdy. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Janakay

customer_reviews.title: Attractive and Highly functional.. Kitty loves it
customer_reviews.text: I just redecorated my living area in mid-century modern with dark walnut tones and clean, geometric lines. With all the new furniture, I was concerned about the cat scratching it all, so I searched for a scratching post which would not clash, yet still hold up to the task. I bought this piece plus some catnip spray and a bitter lemon spray. The catnip went on the scratcher, and the bitter lemon spray went on all my new furniture. My adult Siamese furniture wrecker is no longer wrecking my furniture. Instead, he adoringly loves on his new furniture all the time. This has been an excellent addition to the family room. I will definitely buy again once it wears out.
customer_reviews.author: okraeater

customer_reviews.title: Cool looking but, a bit messy
customer_reviews.text: It looks so cool in the photo and actually looks really cool when it first arrives. I had one of those cat's that scratches everything and I had tried about everything. When I saw this I really liked it because it fit in with the modern design of my house. The cat seemed to love it too. When she wasn't scratching on it she was sleeping on it. The downside is that because it is corrugated cardboard it breaks down quickly and makes a mess. The price seems a bit high for something that will need to be replaced pretty quickly unless you're ok with a large, ragged piece of "furniture"
customer_reviews.author: Wren

customer_reviews.title: Our cat loves this
customer_reviews.text: We refer to this as the cat barge as our cat loves to relax on top of the scratcher after a nice scratching session. When this came in the mail I was legit surprised by how heavy and sturdy the scratcher is. This is pretty heavy duty and lends itself to extended scratching sessions. Our cat also loves to crawl though the holes on the end. At first I thought she was a bit too chubby and we were going to have Pooh bear stuck in the honey tree situation but there was plenty of space.
customer_reviews.author: Chris F.

customer_reviews.title: Rare Combination of Beauty and Function
customer_reviews.text: $50 may seem like a lot to pay for cat furniture made out of cardboard, but this lounger is well worth it. First of all, the cat loved is instantly. As soon as I unwrapped it, he jumped up and started scratching, then settled in pleasantly to well, lounge! He likes snoozing on it and then giving his claws a little workout when he wakes up. Based on current rate of usage (and the fact that you can turn it upside down to use the other side), I think this lounger will last several years.
customer_reviews.author: Momo P.

customer_reviews.title: Kitties Love it
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this scratcher. They use it to lay on and to scratch, which saves my furniture and rugs from their claws. Other scratchers wear out fast or are too small for them to really get on and scratch without it moving around. This one though, is heavy duty (and pretty large as you can see from the picture, kitties can lay on it with room to spare). This scratcher also lasts a long time (this is my 2nd time purchasing because our 2 cats love it so much), and because it has scratching material on both sides, when one side is worn out, you can flip it over. Definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Monica F

customer_reviews.title: After 2 weeks of use-awesome
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because Mr. Emerson started using my nice leather chair instead of the small replacement pad. I could barely get it unpacked before he tried to use it. He used it some for the first few days but kept going back to smaller pad. I took that up and now he uses it all the time. I added the included catnip for good measure. He likes to sleep on it too. He weighs 16 pounds and has room left. It sheds some but not nearly like past cardboard scratch pads. No more using my chair!
customer_reviews.author: K. Murphree

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny!
customer_reviews.text: When is a cat scratcher worth $50? When your super picky cat, who has rejected every other cat scratcher, and who has instead destroyed your couch and is working on destroying the walls, FINALLY approves of a cat scratcher! I am so thankful I took the plunge and took a chance on this cat scratcher. Picky Cat loves it!! She loves to lie on it and scratch on it, like she used to do on the back of the couch. Now she has her own couch that she doesn't get in trouble for scratching. I'm happy. She's happy. It was worth every penny!!!
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Monster cat scratch station
customer_reviews.text: This thing is HUGE. We keep it under the dining room table. It Took a day or two before our cat tried it, but she scratches and sits on it now everyday. She shredded the two smaller ones I got so I am hoping this behemoth can better handle her clawing.
customer_reviews.author: ohiojoy

customer_reviews.title: I’m on my fourth ultimate scratcher- best one on the market hands down.
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats- both love cardboard scratchers and this is the best one on the market by far. They love this thing- they lounge on it and scratch it to pieces. I love that I can get a good 6-9 months out of it before I need to replace it. Being able to flip it over is awesome. It seems pricey at first- but a smaller cardboard scratcher at petsmart would be $20 and last less than a month with my boys, so this is well worth the money. I’ll keep buying these until they stop making them.
customer_reviews.author: LELeach

customer_reviews.title: My Picky Cat LOVES THIS - For Sleeping and Scratching
customer_reviews.text: My cat was clawing the corners of our couch. We bought a cheaper flat scratching box but she wouldn't have anything to do with it. She is very picky and I was skeptical if this would really help but it got so many good reviews I decided to try it. I just can't believe how much she loves this thing. She has completely stopped scratching the couch and now loves to sleep on it (so that saves me from removing cat fur from my desk chair every morning). I am really amazed at how well this works.
customer_reviews.author: avid reader

customer_reviews.title: My cats LOVE it!
customer_reviews.text: My cats absolutely LOVE this scratcher. They will sleep on it, crawl through it, and they prefer scratching it rather than my couch, which was my hope! They spend a great deal of time on it. I’m only giving 4 stars instead of 5 since it arrived damaged and squished in one area. I put that side against the wall so I can’t see it. The box it came in wasn’t damaged, so I think it was packaged and mailed already damaged. Other than that, I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brook

customer_reviews.title: Makes a mess
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this, sadly, I do not. It is made of cardboard, and leaves piles of little cardboard pieces all over! So, now I get to clean up cat hair and pieces of cardboard. If you are not a busy person, and don't mind cleaning up, it won't be a problem. I just hate the mess this product leaves behind.
customer_reviews.author: mighty mo

customer_reviews.title: My cats love this
customer_reviews.text: My cats started using this (and only this) to sharpen their claws the moment it came out of the box. They also treat it as a jungle gym climbing through it and under it. It even looks cool. After two months of use, you can barely tell it’s not brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Your cats will love it!
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this. They love to scratch on it AND sleep on it. The only downside is that it can make a mess - but that's what the vacuum is for. :) Bought it in August and haven't had to flip it over yet. When my kitties were smaller, they would lay INSIDE. But now that they're bigger, they're just on the outside. But they still love it. I've attached pictures. It's quite large. You can see some of the flake-off. And there's an up close picture that shows that the scratcher looks hardly touched.
customer_reviews.author: StacyTwin

customer_reviews.title: Functional and aesthetically pleasing
customer_reviews.text: I am VERY particular about my decor. I knew my new kitty needed a scratcher and had limited space, so i got this and it is fabulous! He LOVES it - lounges on it all the time and scratches like crazy at it! He loves this more than the amazing cat tree I purchased for him. This is a great piece and I highly recommend. I will be purchasing one for each level of my home!
customer_reviews.author: JC
